p: Selectivity of action is an important property of herbicides, but it is rarely observed with substances of natural origin. It is known that citronellal is more effective against broad-leaved weeds [ 233], while cineole is more effective against grassy weeds [ 235]. Selective effects of cineole derivatives on dicotyledonous and monocotyledonous species were demonstrated for 2- endo-hydroxy-1,8-cineole that showed the highest activity against Raphanus sativus, and for 3- exo-hexoxy- 1,8-cineoleâ€”against Lolium rigidum [ 306].
